intro: Brassica juncea var. cuneifolia, commonly known as Chinese kale or kale cabbage, is a cultivated variety of the mustard family. It is characterized by its broad, dark green, crinkled leaves that are often used in Asian cuisines. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has a short, sturdy stem. Its leaves are rich in nutrients, including vitamins A, C, and K, as well as dietary fiber. It thrives in cool climates and is often grown as a leafy vegetable in temperate regions.
